sentence: Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) will begin trading ex-dividend on July 16, 2014.
A cash dividend payment of $0.6436 per share is scheduled to be paid on August 15, 2014.
Shareholders who purchased PG stock prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 7% increase over the same period a year ago.
At the current stock price of $81.32, the dividend yield is 3.17%.
The previous trading day's last sale of PG was $81.32, representing a -5.24% decrease from the 52 week high of $85.82 and a 10.47% increase over the 52 week low of $73.61.
PG is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Unilever PLC ( UL ) and Unilever NV ( UN ).
PG's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $3.76.
Zacks Investment Research reports PG's forecasted earnings growth in 2014 as 3.39%, compared to an industry average of 4%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the PG Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
